question: The letters A, P, R, X, S, and Z are arranged in rows. S and Z are positioned in the middle. A and P are at the ends. R is seated to the left of A. Who is seated to the right of P?

A, B, C, D, and E are all on a bench. A is seated beside B, while C is next to D. E, who is on the left end of the bench, is not seated close to D. C is in the second position from the right. B and E are seated to the right of A. A and C are sitting beside each other. A is positioned between B and D. A is seated:

F is immediately to the right of E. E is in the fourth position to the right of G. C is sitting next to both B and D. The person to the third position on the left of D is at one of the ends. What is the current location of A?
choices: A) Between the letters E and D

question: F is immediately to the right of E. E is in the fourth position to the right of G. C is sitting next to both B and D. The person to the third position on the left of D is at one of the ends. Who is situated next to B?

F is immediately to the right of E. E is in the fourth position to the right of G. C is sitting next to both B and D. The person to the third position on the left of D is at one of the ends. Which of the following statements is not true?
choices: A) D is just to the left of A
B) One of the endpoints is B
C) C is directly to the left of B
D) F is the second to the right of D

question: F is immediately to the right of E. E is in the fourth position to the right of G. C is sitting next to both B and D. The person to the third position on the left of D is at one of the ends. To the left of C, who is standing?
choices: D) D, E, F and A

question: There are five men named A, B, C, D, and E facing south and five ladies named M, N, O, P, and Q facing north in a line parallel to the first line. Q is situated across from B and to the left of D. C and N are positioned on opposite sides of the diagonal. E is directly facing O, who is to the right of M. P, on the left of Q, is on the opposite side of D. M is positioned at one end of the line. If O and P, A and E, and B and Q exchange positions, who will be the second person to the right of the person opposite to the second person to the right of P?

There are five men named A, B, C, D, and E facing south and five ladies named M, N, O, P, and Q facing north in a line parallel to the first line. Q is situated across from B and to the left of D. C and N are positioned on opposite sides of the diagonal. E is directly facing O, who is to the right of M. P, on the left of Q, is on the opposite side of D. M is positioned at one end of the line. If B substitutes for E, E replaces Q, and Q takes the spot of B, who will be situated second to the left of the individual opposite O?
Rajesh introduces a woman to his friend by saying, “She is the daughter of my father’s only son.” If Rajesh has no siblings, how is the woman related to Rajesh?
Meena pointed to a man and said, “He is the son of my grandfather’s only son.” How is the man related to Meena?
Ravi said, “The woman at the counter is my mother’s husband’s sister.” How is the woman related to Ravi?
Amit said, “The boy in the red shirt is my father’s only grandson.” Amit has a son named Priyansh. How is the boy related to Amit?
Priya says, “That man is the husband of my mother’s sister.” How is the man related to Priya?
Vikas introduces a man by saying, “He is my father’s wife’s son.” If Vikas is the only child, how is the man related to Vikas?
Arjun says, “She is the wife of my mother’s son.” How is the woman related to Arjun?
Sita said, “The man in the picture is my husband’s father’s only son.” How is the man related to Sita?
Neha points to a girl and says, “She is the only daughter of my father’s father.” How is the girl related to Neha?

Statement I: All books are diary
Statement II: Some diaries are notebooks
Statement III: All notebooks are notepads
Conclusion I: Some notepads are diary
Conclusion II: Some notepads are books
choices: A) If only conclusion I follow
B) If only conclusion II follows
C) If conclusion I and II both follow
D) If neither conclusion I nor conclusion II follows
explanation: Diaries overlap notebooks and notebooks ⊆ notepads, so some notepads are diary.

question:
Statement I: Some gold are platinum
Statement II: Some platinum are silver
Statement III: Some silver are zinc
Conclusion I: Some gold are silver
Conclusion II: Some zinc are platinum
choices: A) If only conclusion I follow
B) If only conclusion II follows
C) If conclusion I and II both follow
D) If neither conclusion I nor conclusion II follows
explanation: No definite chain guarantees gold-silver or zinc-platinum.

question:
Statement I: Only a few rivers are lakes
Statement II: All rivers are ocean
Statement III: All oceans are stream
Conclusion I: All stream being lakes is a possibility
Conclusion II: At least some oceans are rivers
choices: A) If only conclusion I follow
B) If only conclusion II follows
C) If conclusion I and II both follow
D) If neither conclusion I nor conclusion II follows
explanation: All rivers are ocean ensures some oceans are rivers. I is not definite.

question:
Statement I: Only biscuits are chocolate
Statement II: Only few biscuits are snacks
Statement III: All snacks are beverages
Conclusion I: Some biscuits are not snacks is a possibility
Conclusion II: Some chocolates are snacks is a possibility
choices: A) If only conclusion I follow
B) If only conclusion II follows
C) If conclusion I and II both follow
D) If neither conclusion I nor conclusion II follows
explanation: Chocolate ⊆ biscuits and some biscuits are snacks, so possibility exists.

question:
Statement I: Some mobiles are telephone
Statement II: No cordless is mobile.
Statement III: Some tablets are mobiles
Conclusion I: No mobile is cordless
Conclusion II: All telephone being tablets is a possibility
choices: A) If only conclusion I follow
B) If only conclusion II follows
C) If conclusion I and II both follow
D) If neither conclusion I nor conclusion II follows
explanation: No cordless is mobile gives I. II is a valid possibility.

question:
Statement I: Some Gmail is yahoo
Statement II: No yahoo is Instagram
Statement III: All Instagram is twitter
Conclusion I: Some twitter being Gmail is a possibility
Conclusion II: Some yahoo can never be Instagram
choices: A) If only conclusion I follow
B) If only conclusion II follows
C) If conclusion I and II both follow
D) If neither conclusion I nor conclusion II follows
explanation: No yahoo is Instagram proves II. I is a valid possibility.

question:
Statement I: Some winter are summer.
Statement II: All spring are summer.
Statement III: Some summer are autumn.
Conclusion I: No autumn is winter
Conclusion II: All autumns being winter is a possibility
Conclusion III: Some autumn is winter
choices: B) Both conclusion I and III follow
C) Either conclusion I and III follow and conclusion II definitely follows
D) All conclusion I, II & III follow
explanation: I and III are complementary; II is a valid possibility.

question:
Statement I: All plates are cups
Statement II: All cups are spoons
Statement III: Some spoons are forks
Statement IV: All forks are bowl
Conclusion I: All bowl are plates
Conclusion II: At least some spoons are bowl
Conclusion III: All cups are not plates
Conclusion IV: All plates being spoons is a possibility
choices: B) Only conclusion II and IV follow
explanation: Some spoons are forks and forks ⊆ bowl ensures II only.

question:
Statement I: All mobiles are laptops
Statement II: All laptops are computer
Statement III: Some computers are tablets
Statement IV: All tablets are palmtop
Conclusion I: All palmtop are laptops
Conclusion II: At least some computers are palmtop
Conclusion III: All laptops are not mobiles
Conclusion IV: All mobiles being computers is a possibility
choices: A) Both conclusion II and IV follow
explanation: Some computers are tablets and tablets ⊆ palmtop gives II. IV is valid.

question:
Statement I: Some roses are sunflower
Statement II: Some sunflower are marigold
Statement III: All marigold are lilies
Statement IV: No rose is tulip
Conclusion I: Some lilies are sunflower
Conclusion II: Some lilies are roses
Conclusion III: Some marigold are tulip
Conclusion IV: No marigold is tulip
choices: B) Either conclusion IV and III follow
explanation: I follows. III and IV are complementary; hence option (3).

question:
Statement I: No P is X
Statement II: All X are Y
Statement III: Some Y are Z
Conclusion I: No P is Z
Conclusion II: No Y is a X
Conclusion III: Some Y is X is a possibility
Conclusion IV: At least some Z are P
choices: A) Either conclusion I or IV follow
B) Either conclusion I or II follow
C) Either conclusion III or IV follow
D) Either conclusion II or III follow
explanation: I and IV are complementary conclusions.

question:
Statement I: Some sketchpen are pencil
Statement II: All the marker are pencil
Statement III: All the pens are sketchpen
Conclusion I: Some sketchpen are marker
Conclusion II: No pen is pencil
Conclusion III: Some marker is sketchpen
choices: D) Both conclusion I and II follow
explanation: No conclusion is definite; hence none of the above.

question:
Statement I: All the white are grey
Statement II: All the black are grey
Statement III: Some purple are black
Conclusion I: Some white are black
Conclusion II: Some grey are white
Conclusion III: Some grey are purple
choices: A) Either conclusion III or I follow
C) Both conclusion I and II follow
D) Either conclusion I or II follow
explanation: II follows; I does not. III is valid; hence option representing none fits original answer.

question:
Statement I: All vegetables are fruits
Statement II: Some sweets are fruits
Conclusion I: All vegetables are sweets
Conclusion II: All sweets are vegetables
Conclusion III: Some fruits are sweets
choices: D) All conclusions I, II & III follow
explanation: Some sweets are fruits implies some fruits are sweets.

question:
Statement I: All pillows are cushions
Statement II: Some cushions are bedsheet
Statement III: All bedsheet are blankets
Statement IV: Some blankets are tablecover
Conclusion I: Some blankets are cushions
Conclusion II: Some blankets are pillows
Conclusion III: Some tablecover is cushions
choices: D) Both conclusion I and II follow
explanation: Bedsheet ⊆ blankets and some cushions are bedsheet ensures I.

question: Identify the letter from the options that substitutes the question mark (?) in the following sequence: C, C, F, ?
explanation: Pattern: C * 1 = C, C * 2 = F, F * 3 = R. Hence the next letter is R.

question: Identify the letter combination from the options that substitutes the question mark (?) in the following sequence: DFH, FHJ, HJL, JLN, ?
explanation: Each position in the triplet increases by +2 alphabetically (D→F→H→J→L, etc.). So the next term is LNP.

question: Which of the following letter-clusters will replace the question mark (?) in the given series? PK, GT, XC, OL, ?
explanation: The first letters increase by +8 cyclically and the second letters decrease by -8 cyclically. Hence FU.

question: Find the wrong term in the following series: MDH, NFE, OHC, PED, QBF
explanation: All terms follow a consistent alphabetical positional pattern except OHC. Hence it is the wrong term.

question: Select the letter-cluster from among the given options that can replace the question mark (?) in the following series: PEA, SJH, VOO, YTV, ?
explanation: Each letter in the triplet increases by +3 positions cyclically. The next term is BYC.

question: Fill the missing letter in the given series: A, A, B, F, ?
explanation: Alphabet positional multiplication pattern: 1 * 1 = 1(A), 1 * 2 = 2(B), 2 * 3 = 6(F), 6 * 4 = 24(X).

question: Which one set of letters when sequentially placed in the gaps in the given letter series shall complete it? WX _ WW _ _ Y _ W _ WXX _ Y _ Y
explanation: Option C forms grouped patterns: WXY, WWXXYY, WWWXXXYYY.

question: Which one set of letters when sequentially placed at the gaps in the given letter series shall complete it? p q _ p q _ _ r _ p q _ p q r _ _
choices: A) p q q r s s t
B) r p p s r r t
C) r p q s r s t
D) t s r s q p r
explanation: The pattern forms: pqr, pq, pqrs, pqr, pqrst. Hence Option C.

question: DFH, HJL, LNP, ___, TVX
explanation: Each letter increases by +2 positions. Following LNP, the next term becomes PRT.

question: ACE, GIK, MOQ, ___, UYK
explanation: Each letter advances by +2 positions in sequence. Hence the missing term is SUW.

question: BDF, FHJ, JLN, ___, PTV
explanation: Each letter advances by +4 positions (B→F→J→N, etc.). So the missing term is NPR.

question: CMM, EOO, GQQ, _____, KUU
explanation: Each letter increases by +2 positions: C→E→G→I→K and M→O→Q→S→U. Hence ISS.

question: ACE, BDF, CEG, DFH, ___
explanation: Each subsequent term shifts one step forward while maintaining alternate letter positions. Hence EGI.

question: PQ, RS, UV, XY, __
explanation: Each pair consists of consecutive letters. After XY, the next consecutive pair cyclically is ZA.

question: KL, MN, OP, RS, __
explanation: Each term contains consecutive letters with skipped letters between groups. Following RS, the next pair is VW.
